title: LRU Cache
description:
# LRU Cache

Implement a Least Recently Used (LRU) cache class.

An LRU cache evicts the least recently used item when the cache reaches its capacity.

## Example

```python
cache = solution(2)  # capacity of 2
cache.put(1, 1)
cache.put(2, 2)
print(cache.get(1))  # Output: 1
cache.put(3, 3)      # evicts key 2
print(cache.get(2))  # Output: -1 (not found)
cache.put(4, 4)      # evicts key 1
print(cache.get(1))  # Output: -1 (not found)
print(cache.get(3))  # Output: 3
print(cache.get(4))  # Output: 4
```

## Requirements

- Return a class/object with get(key) and put(key, value) methods
- get(key): Return value if exists, -1 otherwise
- put(key, value): Insert/update key-value pair
- Evict LRU item when capacity is exceeded
- Both operations should be O(1) time complexity
starter_code:
class LRUCache:
    def __init__(self, capacity):
        # Initialize the cache
        pass
    
    def get(self, key):
        # Return value or -1 if not found
        pass
    
    def put(self, key, value):
        # Add or update key-value pair
        pass

# Test your solution
cache = LRUCache(2)
cache.put(1, 1)
cache.put(2, 2)
print(cache.get(1))  # Should print 1
test_code:
cache = solution(2)
cache.put(1, 1)
cache.put(2, 2)
assert cache.get(1) == 1, 'Test 1 failed'
cache.put(3, 3)
assert cache.get(2) == -1, 'Test 2 failed: 2 should be evicted'
cache.put(4, 4)
assert cache.get(1) == -1, 'Test 3 failed: 1 should be evicted'
assert cache.get(3) == 3, 'Test 4 failed'
assert cache.get(4) == 4, 'Test 5 failed'
cache2 = solution(1)
cache2.put(1, 1)
cache2.put(2, 2)
assert cache2.get(1) == -1, 'Test 6 failed: capacity 1 test'
assert cache2.get(2) == 2, 'Test 7 failed'
print('PASSED')
